data.event: Madison County is home to Eastern Kentucky University, Berea College, Boone Tavern, and Bybee Pottery,(closed February 2011) one of the oldest pottery operations in the United States.

event.title: lived and built Fort Boonesborough, now

data.event: This is also where famous pioneer Daniel Boone lived and built Fort Boonesborough, now a state historic site.

event.title: came into the area that is Madison County in 1769

data.event: Indian trader John Findley, Daniel Boone, and four others first came into the area that is Madison County in 1769 on a hunting and exploring expedition.

event.title: purchased 20,000,000 acres of land west of the Appalachians (including present-day Madison County) from the Cherokee in 1774

data.event: The Transylvania Company, led by Judge Richard Henderson of North Carolina, purchased 20,000,000 acres of land west of the Appalachians (including present-day Madison County) from the Cherokee in 1774.
The settlement at Fort Boonesborough began in April of 1775.
